29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

470781.name: Past Evils of the Borehole Planet Disaster
470781.lore:
As a descendant bred personally by the Imperator Insectorum, its only desire is to expand the numbers of its kind. It uses giant scythes to harvest planets for its nest, tirelessly nurturing countless offspring, and devastating innumerable lives until the moment of its death.

"On the broken planet, giant locusts blotted out the sky, and swarms of insects poured out of the planet's crust. The stag beetle raised this new nest and presented it as a gift to its Imperator Insectorum... May this horror only exist in historical records, never to appear again."

549209.name: Dream Collection Component
549209.desc: A storage device for Dreamscape creations. Crude material used for enhancement.
549209.lore:
A storage device for broken dreams, providing a fundamental energy source for Dreamscape creations.

"Install this device, and you will get a member of the Sweet Dreams Troupe."
comeFrom: Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

589812.name: Nourishing Honey
589812.desc: The nectar brewed from the juice of flowers growing on the heart tree in the sacred Vonwacq forest. A honey that can accelerate the growth of life. Used to level up Traces moderately for Abundance characters.
589812.lore:
When the Devil emerges from the fertile soil, it is only a round fruit with a stalk as long as a human's forearm. For some reason, it has to defeat its siblings before it has the right to drink nectar and grow into shape.

"You can drink the sap of any tree in this forest, except that one."

633150.name: Dream Flow Valve
633150.desc: A control component for Dreamscape creations. Normal material used for enhancement.
633150.lore:
A dream-building device that regulates desires and controls the Dreamscape creations' emotions.

"If this device fails, you will get a member of the Dreamjolt Troupe."
comeFrom: Dreamjolt Troupe at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

673753.name: Myriad Fruit
673753.desc: The fruit grown on the tip of the heart tree's branch in the sacred Vonwacq forest. It contains the essence of myriad lifeforms. Used to level up Traces significantly for Abundance characters.
673753.lore:
One day and night after drinking the nectar of the divine tree, the ridiculous spherical fruit bloats into a "Devil" wearing fiber armor and wielding a wooden spear and a shield made of leaves. All around its footsteps, living creatures in the forest offer their genes as tributes to the Devil for it to taste, learn, and metamorphose. After that, the Devil will move on to challenge the sea and the sky of Vonwacq.

"Through this method, the ancient sages imprisoned the most terrifying thing within a most ridiculous game."

717091.name: Dream Making Engine
717091.desc: An energy core for Dreamscape creations. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717091.lore:
A dream-building device that constructs fantasies and grants souls to Dreamscape creations.

"If this device malfunctions... try to wake up before you descend into a nightmare, my friend."
comeFrom: Dreamjolt Troupe at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

874339.name: Alien Tree Seed
874339.desc: The seed obtained from the fruit of the heart tree in the sacred Vonwacq forest, carrying the genes of various life forms. Used to level up Traces slightly for Abundance characters.
874339.lore:
The enormous alien holy tree in the sacred Vonwacq forest meticulously records the changes of the ecosystem over countless life cycles, continuously nurturing the ideal "Devil" using the genes of various life forms as seeds.

"Cut this hard fruit open, scoop out the seed from its flesh, and plant it in sacred soil. You'll harvest dozens of leaders in the following year. Just wait for them to decide a winner via a battle royale!"

983280.name: Raging Heart
983280.desc: The memoria core of "Shell of Faded Rage". Can be used for the Ascension of Fire characters.
983280.lore:
The flames of anger will eventually consume themselves, erasing the original cause of the rage, and leaving behind only lingering resentment and an unquenchable core of poisonous hatred.

"The memoria of fury will persist due to the hatred, yet it will also become unrealistic due to that hatred."

ranks.name: Salty Dog
ranks.descHash: When entering the battle, Gallagher regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy and increases Effect RES by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.

ranks.name: Lion's Tail
ranks.descHash: When using the Skill, removes <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> debuff(s) from the target ally. At the same time, increases their Effect RES by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>, lasting for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: Corpse Reviver
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Last Word
ranks.descHash: Extends the duration of the Besotted state inflicted by Gallagher's Ultimate by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: Death in the Afternoon
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Blood and Sand
ranks.descHash: Increases Gallagher's Break Effect by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> and Weakness Break Efficiency by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.

skills.descHash: Deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Gallagher's ATK to a single target enemy.
skills.name: Corkage Fee

skills.descHash: Immediately heals a target ally for #1[i] HP.
skills.name: Special Brew

skills.descHash: Inflicts Besotted on all enemies, lasting for #2[i] turn(s). At the same time, deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Gallagher's ATK to all enemies, and enhances his next Basic ATK to Nectar Blitz.
skills.name: Champagne Etiquette

skills.descHash: The Besotted state makes targets receive #1[f1]% more Break DMG. Every time a Besotted target gets attacked by an ally, the attacking ally's HP is restored by #2[i].
skills.name: Tipsy Tussle

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: Immediately attacks the enemy. Upon entering battle, inflicts Besotted on all enemies, lasting for #1[i] turn(s). And deals Fire DMG equal to #2[i]% of Gallagher's ATK to all enemies.
skills.name: Artisan Elixir

skills.descHash: Deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Gallagher's ATK to a single target enemy. Reduces the target's ATK by #2[f1]%, lasting for #3[i] turn(s).
skills.name: Nectar Blitz

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Increases this unit's Outgoing Healing by an amount equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of Break Effect, up to a maximum Outgoing Healing increase of <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Novel Concoction

embedBonusSkill.descHash: After using the Ultimate, immediately Advances Forward this unit's Action by <nobr>100%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Organic Yeast

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When Gallagher uses Nectar Blitz to attack Besotted enemies, the HP Restore effect of his Talent will also apply to other allies for this time.
embedBonusSkill.name: Bottoms Up

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Gallagher's the name, I'm one of the local "Hounds" around here. Step into Penacony, the Land of Dreams, Nameless one.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: Evenin'. Someone's been workin' hard. Fancy a drink?

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Alright, grown-ups got jobs to do. Off you go, make the best of it.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Tie
voiceItems.text: Tie's all messed up, not that you'd notice. Around Penacony, no one gives a hoot what you're wearing. They don't even care if the person they're talking to is actually real.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Identity
voiceItems.text: "Bloodhound Family" doesn't exactly roll off the tongue. What do they call me? Lapdog? Can't say they're a talented bunch, but they sure do have sharp tongues.

voiceItems.title: Chat: SoulGlad
voiceItems.text: All these years, and SoulGlad's flavor never changes... Ah, the magic of additives.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Daydreams
voiceItems.text: I love strolling the streets of Penacony, watching everyone here lost in their own daydreams... I've toyed with the idea of being an interstellar villain, creating chaos throughout the universe. Worst-case scenario would be a stint in the IPC's prison. Heh, that's an idea I'm still entertaining!

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: Making a drink is a sensory skill. In dreams, creating fizzy concoctions requires adding a bit of your mood. Heavier if you're troubled, a touch sweeter if you're in high spirits... It's not just about mixing beverages. It's about mixing the experiences of life.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: Subpar beverages and desserts usually hide behind chocolate to cover up their inferior flavor, but they don't get past me... It's probably because I can't stand chocolate.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: Among the five great families, the "Hounds" bear the responsibility of safeguarding the land. So... usually it falls to me to handle anyone who steps out of line. Come to think of it, it's much easier to make someone vanish than to make them materialize.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: If you ever spot a crazed teapot, or a phone booth scuttling around, chances are you've bumped into one of the troublemakers from the "Dreamjolt Troupe." No cause for alarm, though — you won't die, just maybe lose a layer of skin.

voiceItems.title: About the Nameless
voiceItems.text: Back when the stars were still connected, this world too saw the footprints of Nameless wanderers. Sadly, Penacony never managed to remember any of their names.

voiceItems.title: About Misha
voiceItems.text: Misha is a sensible kid. Me? At his age I was just a little terror, biting everyone in sight.

voiceItems.title: About Sunday
voiceItems.text: He reminds me of the "Odes of Harmony," but I caught a whiff of something behind the facade he puts on... something real.

voiceItems.title: About Robin
voiceItems.text: We've seen many outsiders come to Penacony, but locals leaving? That's rare... She must have had her reasons.

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: Careful, don't get too lost in those sweet dreams.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: Intuition, instinct... training can sharpen them both.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: Time is slipping away fast.

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: Need I say more? Muscle memory never lies.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Show me some of that Trailblazing strength again.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Misha
voiceItems.text: Enough gallivanting, kid. Better get to bed early, or you won't grow.

voiceItems.title: About Misha 2
voiceItems.text: When I met Mikhail he was already grown up... but whatever the case, Misha's still here. He's spent his whole life with me, and for that, I should be glad.
voiceItems.unlockRequirement: Unlocked after completing the Trailblaze Mission "And on the Eighth Day"

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Robin
voiceItems.text: No matter where I am in the future, I will definitely still hear your singing.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: That's all you've got?

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Decided to play your ace, huh?

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: So? In the mood for another beating?

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: You've arrived, eh? Step up, let's see you.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Gonna keep going? If not, I'll catch my breath for a while.

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Let's kick things off with you.

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack
voiceItems.text: It ain't over yet.

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Time to mix things up.

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: How's this taste?

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: I like that confidence.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: ...It's nothing.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Life's like a good brew – full-bodied and sweet.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: My friends, indulge yourselves!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: If I could do it all again...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: My mission isn't over...

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Thanks, pal.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Watch yourself.

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: Everyone holding up okay?

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Now this smells good.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: Haha, finders keepers.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Life... is just so beautiful.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: Life is just full of puzzles.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: Who knew I'd be so good at this.

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: I'll be taking point.

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: If you're tired, just find a place to sit down for a while.

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
A security officer from the Bloodhound Family in Penacony. He is also a slovenly and indolent drinksmith.
Though unorganized in apparel and casual in how he makes his drinks, he is always courteous toward visiting guests but keeps his vigilance about him.
He seems to carry a weight of a complicated past, yet he never voluntarily divulges any details.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
"The scent of tobacco, candy, and cheap shampoo... he gives off the typical smell of a middle-aged bachelor. While his clothes are tidy, they are always wrinkled and display a lack of style. He also displays no desire to look after his appearance. He doesn't have many friends, and his favorite pastime after work is enjoying a few glasses of Dreamjoy Special. Always sitting at the same spot, with the same drink, and with the same waiters... It's never changed in more than a decade.

Yet such a man won the admiration and respect of the Bloodhound Family members — this is probably related to the scar etched across his face. In a sweet dream practically devoid of any accidents, an ugly scar serves as a rare honor for a security officer, symbolizing seniority and prestige.

Whenever confronted with a case, he would first unwrap a piece of candy and put it in his mouth. When the candy is almost gone with his chewing, he dives into the investigation with furrowed brows and ponders the clues until late in the bar. However, unlike the young officers, he seems to no longer find pleasure in apprehending suspects. When he gazes into the eyes of the so-called criminals who fell so far in the sweet dream, I see no sense of accomplishment in his eyes, only a profound emptiness and melancholy.

I actually understand him. When you reach this stage of life, you'll start to doubt the meaning behind the life you've previously led. It was just like what I have experienced."
— Note: The Security Officer of the Bloodhound Family

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
"People need an opportunity to connect with each other, and the diverse special mixes within the Dreamscape serve as catalysts for such reactions.

As I check out my surroundings, I soon notice an individual who's used to suavely navigating through life.

Using the Dreamjoy Special's fame as a starting point, he starts the conversation with the history of syrups and SoulGlad, explaining to the guests the connection between the time spent shaking the drink and the flavor of the final product. Then, he talks about the degrees of fit between the special mix's aroma with an individual's personality, and how to master the secret of matching the right ingredients... The surrounding faces drown in darkness. He listens to the whispers of sorrow or joy, all the while coldly observing the hearts of the masses as the drinking party continues.

He waits for all the guests to depart, then polishes the silver cups on his own until they gleam while gazing out the door. Day after day, he waits for someone who will never return, waiting for that person to give him an eternal lie that will end such a never-ending destiny.

He walks alone down the street as lights go out one after another, and he casts a long shadow behind him —
Perhaps I, too, will step on to the same predetermined path as he is on."
— Note: Dreamjoy Drinksmith

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
"There is only happiness in the sweet dream, which forms its greatest misfortune.

These disillusioned individuals in the dream are terrified of The Family chasing them away. They wander like specters on the fringes of the Dreamscape, carefully concealing their emotions and avoiding memories that smell sour or bitter. Their defenses will only crumble during the brief moments after they imbibe the special mix as if they want to say everything they would ever want to say in the rest of their lives...

'If people who look down on me lined up, the queue be long enough to go around The Reverie three times. But those who are willing to treat me with respect... *sigh* there's one less of them every time one of them dies...'
'Everyone daydreams. When I was your age, I aspired to become an intergalactic outlaw. The result is clear: The daydream shattered.'
'You won't notice it when your tie is askew. In Penacony, no one cares about what others were. They don't even care if others are *human* or not.'
...

Their words ring hollow, often insincere and perfunctory, never revealing their true thoughts. However, that's the only way the story can feel real."
— Note: Disillusioned Ones in the Dreamscape

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"During working hours, he presents himself as a seasoned and composed security officer. His prime has passed, he is more lenient, and his ambitions and aspirations have faded with the shattering of his dreams. After work, he would head to the familiar lounge to spend the long nights, mixing drinks for himself and longtime friends. As glasses clink, those conversations flow and fizzle like foams, then instantly disappear.

He reminisces about the golden years when he yearned for freedom despite his captivity. Together, they fought against oppression, entrusting their lives to one another. They dreamed of a free land. They might die any moment, yet acted as if they already held countless wonderful tomorrows within their grasp. However, there were not enough of them to fight back. Familiar friends perished one by one. Ideals crumbled, and atrocities prevailed...

'Is that something you lived through? You... you must be kidding, right?' The guest interrupts his gloomy soliloquy.
'Of course not. How can it possibly be true?' He smiles and resumes his work.

...Gallagher is my most truthful lie. Sometimes, I can't even distinguish between him and myself."
— Note: Gallagher

name: Gallagher
descHash: A security officer of the Bloodhound Family at Penacony. He is always courteous toward visiting guests but keeps his vigilance about him. He seems to carry a weight of a complicated past, yet he never voluntarily divulges any details.
